Package org.soen6441.controller

Class MapController

java.lang.Object
org.soen6441.controller.MapController
public class MapController
extends java.lang.Object
This class update the MapModel. Also receives the acknowledgement for the update and pass it back to the parent GameEngine.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    MapController​(Map p_Map)
    This is a constructor which receives Map object as parameter which is used throughout the class

  • Constructor Details

    • MapController

      public MapController​(Map p_Map)
      This is a constructor which receives Map object as parameter which is used throughout the class
      Parameters:
      p_Map - This is a reference of Map object (within GameModel) passed from parent GameEngine.

  • Method Details

    • saveMap

      public java.lang.String saveMap​(java.lang.String p_Str) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method calls the savemap method of the mapmodel to save the map in file.
      Parameters:
      p_Str - the command given by user to save map
      Returns:
      l_Result a feedback message on success or error of save function.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - throws exception when there is any error during savemap

    • loadMap

      public java.lang.String loadMap​(java.lang.String p_Str) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method calls the loadmap method of mapmodel and passes the filename parameter to load a map which is in file
      Parameters:
      p_Str - It is the command from the CommandPrompt
      Returns:
      l_result a feedback message on success or error
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - throws exception if there is any exception occured during loading the map

    • reset

      public void reset()
      This method will call the reset method of mapmodel class

    • validateMap

      public java.lang.String validateMap() throws java.lang.Exception
      This method calls the Validate map method from the mapmodel class
      Returns:
      String which says if map is valid or not.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if there is no map created

    • editMap

      public java.lang.String editMap​(java.lang.String p_Command, java.lang.String p_Str) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method takes the keyword and entire command from the CommandPrompt and then checks it with all the cases. After checking it performs the specific functionality and returns the feedback accordingly
      • If the command is to add continent, country or neighbor, it goes into the first block and calls respective method of map model.
      • If the command is to remove continent, country or neighbor, it goes into the second block and calls respective method of map model.
      • Counters are used in order to send back feedback on number of country/continent/neighbor added or removed.
      • In case of exception thrown by the model during add/remove functionality, this method receives it and delegate to the Game Engine to display on view.
      Parameters:
      p_Command - The Keyword to access the specific case in the switchcase
      p_Str - The entire command from the CommandPrompt
      Returns:
      l_ReturnString returns feedback on every functionality performed
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - throws exception if any error in performing a certain functionality
